CommandslistÂ¶

Note

You can find the permissions for the commands at the permission list.

  • Commandslist
    • User Commands
      • /petblock
      • /petblock [gui-path]
      • /petblock call
      • /petblock toggle
      • /petblock rename <name>
      • /petblock skin <skin>
    • Admin Commands
      • /petblockreload
      • /petblocks [page]
      • /petblocks enable [player]
      • /petblocks disable [player]

      • /petblocks togglesound [player]
      • /petblocks toggleparticle [player]
      • /petblocks inv <from> <to> [player]

      • /petblocks debug [player]

User CommandsÂ¶

/petblockÂ¶

This user command opens the PetBlocks GUI.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

/petblock [gui-path]Â¶

This user command opens the PetBlocks GUI at the given gui path. Opening gui paths directly requires the corresponding permission to this path.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Opens the gui storage page (Requires the permission petblocks.command.use.gui.storage)

/petblock gui.storage

Opens the gui main page (Requires the permission petblocks.command.use.gui.main)

/petblocks gui.main

/petblock callÂ¶

This user command teleports the userâs own pet to the user. Also spawns the pet if it has not spawned yet.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

/petblock toggleÂ¶

This user command spawns or despawns the userâs pet.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

/petblock rename <name>Â¶

This user command allows setting the name of the userâs own pet.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Set your pet name to the name MyPet.

/petblock rename MyPet

Set your pet name to the name My Super Cool Pet.

/petblock rename My Super Cool Pet

Set your pet name to the name My Cool Pet with colors.

/petblock rename &eMy &aCool &cPet

/petblock skin <skin>Â¶

This user command allows setting the skin of the userâs own pet to any player or url.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Set your pet skin to the player skin Shynixn:

/petblock skin Shynixn

Set your pet skin to the skin Black Cat by a base64 encoded url

/petblock skin eyJ0ZXh0dXJlcyI6eyJTS0lOIjp7InVybCI6Imh0dHA6Ly90ZXh0dXJlcy5taW5lY3JhZnQubmV0L3RleHR1cmUvOWU0ZmNiOWNjYWU0ZjA2MzljNjg5ZTY1NjViNTIwNWQ3YWJhY2EyMTYwY2ZmNmIwYTVlOTA2ZDhiMTQ4MTkzMyJ9fX0=

Set your pet skin to the skin Black Cat by a full texture url

/petblock skin http://textures.minecraft.net/texture/9e4fcb9ccae4f0639c689e6565b5205d7abaca2160cff6b0a5e906d8b1481933

Set your pet skin to the skin Black Cat by a shortened texture url

/petblock skin textures.minecraft.net/texture/9e4fcb9ccae4f0639c689e6565b5205d7abaca2160cff6b0a5e906d8b1481933

Admin CommandsÂ¶

Note

All admin commands can be executed via the server console.

Warning

The admin commands do not work on offline players.

/petblockreloadÂ¶

This admin command reloads the config.yml and runtime cache of the plugin.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Reloads the PetBlocks plugin

/petblockreload

/petblocks [page]Â¶

This admin command opens the command list for administrators.

The optional [page] parameter specifies the target command list page.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Opens page 1

/petblocks

Opens page 2

/petblocks 2

/petblocks enable [player]Â¶

Respawns the pet of the given player.

The optional [player] parameter specifies the target player otherwise the player executing the command gets used.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Enable your pet

/petblocks enable

Enable the pet of player Mario

/petblocks enable Mario

/petblocks disable [player]Â¶

Removes the pet of the given player.

The optional [player] parameter specifies the target player otherwise the player executing the command gets used.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Disable your pet

/petblocks disable

Disable the pet of player Mario

/petblocks disable Mario

/petblocks toggle [player]Â¶

Enables or disables the pet of the given player.

The optional [player] parameter specifies the target player otherwise the player executing the command gets used.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Toggles your pet

/petblocks toggle

Toggles the pet of player Mario

/petblocks disable Mario

/petblocks ai <path> [player]Â¶

Changes the pet ai from the given player to the specified ais at the given config.yml path.

The <path> parameter specifies the section in your config.yml where the item is located. Please take a look at the example below.

The optional [player] parameter specifies the target player otherwise the player executing the command gets used.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Warning

The same ais can be added multiple times per default.

Sample list:

Applies the pet ai from the default pet configuration in the config.yml.

/petblocks ai pet

Apply a custom ai to a pet.

  1. Include the follow ai section anywhere in your config.yml.

config.yml

mycustomais:
 fastfollowai:
   add-ai:
    1:
      type: 'follow-owner'
      min-distance: 3.0
      max-distance: 10.0
      speed: 5.0
   remove-ai:
    1:
      type: 'follow-owner'

Note

Execute the /petblockreload command after changing the config.yml.

2. Execute the follow command

/petblocks ai mycustomais.fastfollowai

/petblocks skin <path> [player]Â¶

Sets the pet skin from the given player to the specified skin at the given config.yml path.

The <path> parameter specifies the section in your config.yml where the item is located. Please take a look at the example below.

The optional [player] parameter specifies the target player otherwise the player executing the command gets used.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Applies the pet skin from the default pet configuration in the config.yml.

/petblocks skin pet.skin

Apply a custom skin to a pet.

  1. Include the follow skin section anywhere in your config.yml.

config.yml

mycustomskins:
 marioskin:
  id: 397
  damage: 3
  skin: 'http://textures.minecraft.net/texture/a0c2549a893726988f3428bef799875ba871688ae64eb0cfdc43f7d6e24c6c'

Note

Execute the /petblockreload command after changing the config.yml.

2. Execute the follow command

/petblocks skin mycustomskins.marioskin

/petblocks rename [player]Â¶

Renames the pet of the given player.

The optional [player] parameter specifies the target player otherwise the player executing the command gets used.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Renames your pet to Beast

/petblocks rename Beast

Renames your pet to My awesome Pet

/petblocks rename &aMy awesome Pet

/petblocks togglesound [player]Â¶

Toggles the pet sounds of the given player.

The optional [player] parameter specifies the target player otherwise the player executing the command gets used.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Toggles the sound

/petblocks togglesound

Toggles the sound of player Shynixn

/petblocks togglesound Shynixn

/petblocks toggleparticle [player]Â¶

Toggles the pet particles of the given player.

The optional [player] parameter specifies the target player otherwise the player executing the command gets used.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Toggles the particle

/petblocks toggleparticle

Toggles the particle of player Shynixn

/petblocks toggleparticle  Shynixn

/petblocks inv <from> <to> [player]Â¶

Warning

Editing the pet inventory is not possible. Use the /petblocks reset command to delete the pet inventory of a certain player if the player violates a rule.

Opens the pet inventory of the given player in readonly mode.

The <from> and <to> parameters specify the index range of the slots of the unlimited inventory.

The optional [player] parameter specifies the target player otherwise the player executing the command gets used.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Opens your pet inventory in readonly mode.

/petblocks inv 1 54

Opens the pet inventory of player Shynixn in readonly mode.

/petblocks inv 1 54 Shynixn

/petblocks reset [player]Â¶

Resets the pet settings of the given player to the default pet settings in the config.yml.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Resets the pet

/petblocks reset

Resets the pet of player Shynixn

/petblocks reset Shynixn

/petblocks debug [player]Â¶

Displays the debug menu of the pet of the specified player to the player executing this command.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Displays the debug menu of your own pet

/petblocks debug

Displays the debug menu of Shynixn to yourself

/petblocks debug Shynixn

/petblocks killnextÂ¶

Kills the nearest entity. Does not kill other players.

  • Players (require permissions) â

  • Server console â

  • Command blocks â

Sample list:

Kills the nearest entity in the current chunk

/petblocks killnext
